intro: Panaetia lessonii, commonly known as the lesson's panaetia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky and dry habitats. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, typical of the carrot family. Panaetia lessonii is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
